events.title: First successful U.S. Pony Express run completed
events.description: The Pony Express completed its first successful run, delivering mail from Missouri to California in about 10 days, significantly reducing communication time across the continent.
events.significance: Marked a milestone in rapid communication in the U.S. before the telegraph became widespread.

events.title: The first ball dropped in Times Square
events.description: The inaugural New Year's Eve ball drop took place in New York City's Times Square to celebrate the new year.
events.significance: Became an iconic annual event symbolizing the arrival of the New Year.

events.title: President Harry S. Truman signs the Marshall Plan into law
events.description: The U.S. initiated the European Recovery Program (Marshall Plan) to aid Western Europe's economic recovery after World War II.
events.significance: Helped rebuild war-torn Europe and curb the spread of communism during the Cold War.

events.title: Skylab is launched by NASA
events.description: The United States launched Skylab, its first space station, to study the effects of long-duration spaceflight and conduct scientific experiments.
events.significance: Advanced human space exploration and scientific research in orbit.

events.title: Dolly the sheep, the first cloned mammal, is introduced to the public
events.description: Scientists revealed the birth of Dolly, demonstrating that mammals can be cloned from adult cells.
events.significance: Opened new possibilities and ethical debates in genetics and biotechnology.
